Question
========
What general takeaway about learning programming languages is emphasized?

Answerlist
----------
* Core concepts like variables, loops, and functions transfer across languages
* Every programming language requires completely different thinking
* Only R uses concepts like loops and functions
* Learning a second language is harder after you know one

Solution
========
Once you learn foundational concepts (e.g., variables, loops, functions) they apply across languages, making it easier to pick up new ones.

Answerlist
----------
* True
* False
* False
* False
